name: lentil soup
ingredients: 200 g of red lentils (or 250 g of dry lentils)
50 g of olive oil (or a drizzle)
½ tsp of ground white pepper (adjust to taste)
½ tsp of ground cayenne pepper (optional)
½ tsp of freshly grated nutmeg (optional)
1600 g of canned tomato purée (or crushed tomatoes)
4 - 5 sprigs of fresh coriander (stemmed, for garnish)
4 cloves of garlic (minced) (if no onions are used)
1 tsp of Moroccan Ras el Hanout (optional)
steps: Peel and mince the onions (or garlic if used).
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil. Sauté the onion (or garlic and spices as per the recipe) until translucent (4 min at 100°C/speed 1 in a Thermomix).
Add the spices (ginger, coriander, cumin, paprika, pepper, cinnamon, turmeric, etc.) and sauté for a few minutes to release the flavors.
Add the water, stock cubes, rinsed and drained lentils, and tomato purée (or crushed tomatoes).
Bring to a boil, then simmer over low heat for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
If you pre-blanched the lentils, drain them after 2 minutes of cooking and add them to the pot with the water and the rest of the ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh coriander.
